page.title: 18Ecology of Kettlethorpe area
page.content: The soil is sandy loam with pockets of clay. As sandy soil dries out quickly types of vegetation are limited. Many species of plant life have been lost as much of the area is now cultivated farmland. However, a large amount of unspoilt hedgerow still exists throughout the area and comprises of TREES:Oak,Lime,Sycamore,Silver Birch, Beech,Holly,Elder,Gorse,Blackthorn, Hawthorn,Aspen,Alder and Blackberry. PLANTS:Nettles,Rosebay Willow herb, Mustard,Thistles,White Campion,Dock, Deadly Nightshade,Burdock and Ragwort. WILDLIFE:Crow,Robin,Tits,Pheasant,Hawk Greenfinch,Partridge,Lapwing,Wren,Duck Yellow Hammer,Magpie,Moorhen,Coot and Thrushes.Hedgehogs, Rabbits,Foxes, Badgers, Moles and Red and Grey Squirrels. BUTTERFLIES:Skippers,Meadow Brown,Red Admirals,small and large White,Tortoiseshells and Peacocks.
